prompt: Explain the importance of test-driven development (TDD) in large codebases.

criteria.name: Understanding of TDD
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of what test-driven development is and how it works.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains TDD, its cycle (red-green-refactor), and how it is applied in real projects.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurately describes TDD and its main steps.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions TDD but gives limited explanation.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of TDD.

criteria.name: Application to Large Codebases
criteria.description: Explains why TDD is especially valuable for large projects.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully discusses maintainability, regression prevention, and scalable collaboration.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes TDD benefits like fewer bugs and easier changes in big projects.
performance_descriptors.average: States TDD is good for large projects but gives little detail.

criteria.name: Use of Real-World Examples
criteria.description: Provides examples of TDD in large software projects.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Multiple, relevant examples with clear explanations.
performance_descriptors.good: At least one clear example provided.
performance_descriptors.average: Example is vague or minimally described.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents answer in a logical, academic style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized, formal, and clear response.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear structure and mostly formal style.

key_points: Explains TDD process (write test, code, refactor)
Discusses maintainability, catching regressions, safe refactoring
Gives real-world examples: Google, large open-source projects
llm_questions: Why is TDD important for large codebases?
Can you give real-world examples of TDD in big projects?
How does TDD help teams collaborate on large systems?
